channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NM
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NM

  • Description: A pallet of 50 lb. bags of un1727 was pulled off the tail of trailer 551305. After the pallet was moved to the dock, the dockworker noticed a small amount of powder on the floor of the trailer where the pallet had been and upon checking the pallet for damage, found a small amount of powder had forme d a small mound next to the pallet.

item.title: Report X-2023060268
item.description:
Report X-2023060268

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-25
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was getting ready to be processed when it was discovered that the outer package was slightly wet and the smell of gasoline was present. Upon this discovery, package was moved to a dedicated spill response area. DescribePack: The lid on the can of jet fuel had come loose causing a small amount of the fuel to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed upright in a dedicated spill release area.

item.title: Report X-2023060202
item.description:
Report X-2023060202

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-22
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: unloaded from trailer and was brought to QA where further inspection was done. One of the contents had a loose cap and lost some of the liquid. About a cup was missing from one of the bottles. DescribePack: box was wet and soggy from the internal leakage. The corner of the box gave out once picked up to be placed into the drum. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a plastic bin.

item.title: Report E-2023050687
item.description:
Report E-2023050687

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-10
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ON May 10, 2023, six (6) bags of calcium peroxide (UN1457) were damaged during transit and released approximately 25-pounds of product to the trailer interior and pallet below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Advanced Environmental Solutions (AES) to remediate the impacted surfaces. AES personnel swept up the pure product and placed it in its own 55-gallon poly drum. The crew also wiped down the impacted freight and rewrapped the product for further shipment. All UN1457-impacted material was placed in one (1) separate 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023051096
item.description:
Report X-2023051096

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-16
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Bucket was brought to QA by manager. Inspection found that the shipping label, secondary barcode and vision labels were all blacked out. Further inspection found that the lid of the bucket had a crack along at the center and the liquid was able to leak out if the bucket was moved around too much. DescribePack: The crack was at the center part of the lid. The crack is small in terms of width but is 3/4 of an inch long. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bucket was placed up right and transported by a cage as to not have the bucket move around too much. Bucket was then placed on pallet grate to ensure liquid didn't spill onto floor during inspection, bucket then safely placed inside hazmat bin.

item.title: Report X-2023051083
item.description:
Report X-2023051083

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-15
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was sent up the belts and was removed at the sortation tower. A package handler trainer noticed it was leaking and alerted a manager who brought it to QA in a spill tote. DescribePack: Closures were open upon discovery and the leaking was found towards the top of the package. One of the corners had become torn due to the liquid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a bucket to contain the leaking and was then placed on a spill grate.

DescribePack: One plastic container was crushed and the cap malfunction content leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The wet package was removed from the trailer and placed in a tote.

item.title: Report X-2023050528
item.description:
Report X-2023050528

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-03
  • City: SANTA TERESA
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver stated that during the movement of the truck, the package flipped on to its side which caused it to spill. Afterwards, the driver returned it to the station, where it was discovered by admins who then secured it in a red bin with a plastic bag. DescribePack: Package was failed because the box was wet on one of the sides. Contents leaked because the package flipped onto its side while the truck was moving. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Driver upon discovery secured the package to return it safely to the station. Afterwards the admins in the station secured it in a red bin with a plastic bag.

item.title: Report E-2023050241
item.description:
Report E-2023050241

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-03
  • City: MENTMORE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 3, 2023, at 1954 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Mentmore, New Mexico regarding the release of approximately 1 gallon of DELTA-THERM™ AR 8501 Polyol (Chemical under pressure, n.o.s., UN3500, 2.2) from (1) 3500-gallon metal tank. The release was reportedly due to a loading strap striking the release valve. No drains or waterways were affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using a pressure washer and the proper PPE. The released material impacted rinse water was containerized in (1) 55-gallon metal drum which was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023050325
item.description:
Report X-2023050325

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-04
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: NAYX 301438 was found in the Albuquerque yard by a NM State HM inspector to have wetness around the threads on the BOV cap. BNSF HazMat manager responded to investigate. The BOV cap was hand tight, but was able to be turned about 1/8 turn with a pipe wrench. The leak subsided and the car was released. No ground impacts,
